You sure i spoke to the service team while back ,told me they only use optus for instate connections,IN the citys where optus has network's. optus generaly does not have any network outside NSW/VIC bar a few small areas the rest of my republic would be AAPT it would have to be to offer unlimited in buttfuck no where towns.

Optus don't really own any ISP,they just charge a fee for access to the fibre network they maintin in the citys and connections to SEA where they have a huge presence from SINGTEL
Telstra though runs. Bigpond/telstra/Belong/MateCommunicate/Active8Me 3 others but i can't think of the name right now
Vocus,who used to be M2. Or AKA DODO. Own the following. Eftel,Clubtelco,Ishitmus,amnet.aanet,and nextgen networks.DODO
They have pretty poor peering arrangements and are known to have peak hour issues on a lot of NBN POI systems due to not having enough CVC capacity steer clear if ur in a built up area
TPG owns the following.. Adam Internet AAPT Limited SHIT(17 faults on there backend network in the last 15 months one lasted for 2 days so fuckign shit) Agile Communications Shit unless ur looking for a SLA agreement then they become good and start making ur boy parts feel real good. Chime Communications SHIT iiNet Customer service went to shit. Internode See above Netspace Dead it's just IINET PIPE Networks Still half decent corporate services and peering arrangements TransACT Ballarat and geelong HFC can reach speeds of 850Mbps easily with no errors on the network they currently have it uncapped to 250Mbps down which is a plus sign for HFC if it's done right. Westnet dunno?
Tpg i will admit have wisened up slightly and are slowly trying to upgrade the services they offer. the problem is they are always weeks late to the party. They chuck more CVC onto the system,it get's gobbled back up in a day or 2 and then ur back to congestion problems they need to buy it in 100Mbit blocks not the 15 they do now.
Then you have the smaller firms. and asian firms putting foot into the water
Skymesh,Aussie broadband,AusBBS,Leaptel,Tangerine,Bendigo bank, Mynetfone myrepublic Most of them run the networks off AAPT back ends if they provide an unlimited service if it's usually got a quota on the plan then it will generally be vocus. and a little bit of telstra in there as well if u live off the aapt/vocus grid
Then you have the ppl just in it to make money that can't sustain the service they provide.
Like my republic,how anyone with basic math skills can think they can sustain 100mbps with no data caps for 59 a month when that costs them 50 bucks from NBN co alone. eventually too many ppl will join cause of the ZOMG THE PRICE IS SO LOW. and clusterfucks will ensue
Your best bet right now,especially if you get a FTTN connection is to go with a small firm that can chase down service fault's instead of reading of a fault script next to their computer in the Philippines.
